definition: to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])
position/location/place/seat/classifier for people (honorific)/classifier for binary bits (e.g. 十六位 16-bit or 2 bytes)/(physics) potential

sentences.english: He was forced to 8)abdicate and all over the country flags flew at 9)half-mast.
sentences.chinese: 他被迫讓位，爲此舉國降下半旗。

sentences.english: I 4. feel that I should give place to a younger man.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲我應該讓位給年青人了。

sentences.english: Genre painting gives way to landscape.
No people gave the seat to the oldie.
sentences.chinese: 沒人讓位給那位老人坐。

sentences.english: XuanZu pass, announced plans to give way to the light, the sea king attitude very firmly.
sentences.chinese: 宣祖召集羣臣，宣佈要讓位給光海君，態度甚爲堅決。
和諧已經讓位給了不和諧。

sentences.english: However, these grandiose dreams soon gave way to more practical concerns.
sentences.chinese: 然而，這些宏大的夢想很快讓位給了更加實際的考慮。

sentences.english: At one point, pieces of rock gave way, and Corbett dropped down quickly.
sentences.chinese: 有一點的岩石碎片讓位和科比特快速回落。

sentences.english: In the Fang's court, action has given way to procedural points.
sentences.chinese: 在銀牙的宮廷中，實幹讓位給了程序步驟。

sentences.english: Xiao Ming is a bully, playing a long time also not retire.
sentences.chinese: 小明很霸道，玩了很長時間也不讓位。

sentences.english: And my sick muse doth give an other place.
sentences.chinese: 我的病詩神只好給別人讓位。

sentences.english: He was forced to abdicate and all over the country flags flew at half-mast.
sentences.chinese: 他被迫讓位，爲此舉國降下半旗。

sentences.english: That means some things have to fall off the plate for the current iteration.
sentences.chinese: 那意味着有些事情必須推遲進行，讓位給當前的迭代。

definition: to treat as guilty those associated with an offender (family, neighbors etc)
to enumerate sb's shortcomings/to criticize/to scold/to talk on and on
in a way that justifies the use of the term/genuine/proper/in a way that conforms to logic/justifiable/appropriate/perfectly legitimate
to give up one's seat for sb
to come off sentry duty/to lay off (a worker)/laid-off
to drag sb before a public meeting to denounce, humiliate and physically abuse them (esp. during the Cultural Revolution)
to get on or into (a bus, train, car etc)
see 未可厚非[wei4 ke3 hou4 fei1]
